The evidence in this case was overwhelming, as are the lessons and commitments for change we must take from it. 

Policing should make all communities safer. As a nation & a people who believe in fundamental principles of liberty and justice for all, we must accept nothing less.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text:
But in an age of instant video, it confronted us with the cold brutality of that racism. It challenged us to witness a lynching & call it anything less. 

Derek Chauvin‚Äôs actions exposed our justice system as not only flawed but deadly and‚Äîit must be said‚Äîin grave need of reform.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text:
George Floyd‚Äôs murder was not the first of its kind, nor the last. America‚Äôs institutions have long treated black people and other people of color as less human, less worthy of justice or fairness or even care.

When we were able to evacuate the House gallery, we did so by jumping over rows of chairs while wearing gas masks as officers barricaded the doors with guns drawn. 

This unprecedented assault by President Trump‚Äôs most loyal followers was nothing less than an attempted coup. 

3/

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text:
As the crowd forced its way inside, the doors to our House chamber were locked and my colleagues and I were asked to hide under chairs to prevent being struck by stray bullets. 

2/

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text:
Today, as Congress gathered to undertake one of its most solemn duties‚Äîcounting electoral votes and confirming the will of the people in the Presidential election‚Äîa violent and seditious mob urged on by the current President of the United States descended on the U.S. Capitol.

1/

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: The House will vote today on the Heroes Act, crisis-response legislation that scales up national testing, tracing and treatment, puts money in the pockets of America's workers, improves the Paycheck Protection Program and much more.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text:
As Congress fights to ensure our long-term economic recovery, we cannot afford to overlook our clean energy sectors, which support millions of Americans and will put us on a path to becoming a cleaner, healthier and more resilient country.
https://t.co/nBVFsNjcLI

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text:
But if the House and Senate bring the same spirit of unity & resilience to our work that the American people have shown throughout this crisis, The Heroes Act will be signed into law quickly and its urgent assistance will reach the people who need it most.

/end

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: There‚Äôs work to be done here to deliver our smart and timely crisis aid package to the American people. Just as we did before with the CARES Act, this will take a bipartisan effort and the President‚Äôs signature to make it happen.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: - Elimination of the harmful and deeply unfair State and Local Tax (SALT) deduction limitation for Tax Years 2020 and 2021

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: - Billions invested in critical systems including specific funding for primary and higher education, community health centers, emergency services, hospitals and other providers, Medicaid, highway infrastructure, biomedical research and much more.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: - Support for small businesses by strengthening the Payroll Protection Program to (1) make sure it can reach underserved communities & diverse nonprofits, and (2) is flexible by providing $10 billion for COVID-19 emergency grants through the Economic Injury Disaster Loan program.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: - Money in the pockets of workers with a second round of direct payments to families up to $6,000 per household, new payroll protection measures to keep 60 million workers connected with their jobs and extending weekly $600 federal unemployment payments through next January.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: - An additional $75 billion for the testing, tracing and treatment we need in order to have a science-based path to safely reopen our country and helping ensure that every American can access free #coronavirus treatment.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text:
Here are just a few of the other things the Heroes Act includes to help struggling families and communities: 

- Strong support for our heroes through establishing a $200 billion Heroes‚Äô fund to ensure that essential workers across the country receive hazard pay.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: His humble beginnings were a statement of the uniquely American dream that touched many of our immigrant ancestors, and his life of service was a testament to the deep humanitarian spirit of our hometown.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: Kirk‚Äôs enduring connection with Amsterdam gave us a sense of pride and faith to know the kid next door could make it in the bright lights of Hollywood.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: Kirk‚Äôs name is memorably emblazoned on the deck of our iconic Mohawk Valley Gateway Overlook as a reminder of his roots, his strength and the values and spirit of community that can come from growing up in the Mohawk Valley.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: Kirk started his great career on the stage of Amsterdam High School and today he is immortalized in places throughout our city.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text:
Each of the 20 were special. Let their names and stories fill our voices today, and let their memories be forever part of who we are and guide us for another year. 

May they Rest In Peace.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: To stand with families and friends who have lost immeasurably, to grieve with them, to struggle with them, to try again to pick up the shattered pieces of ourselves in a shared, soulful remembrance.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: The first anniversary of any tragedy brings a painful renewal of grief and loss. In these times, even if we think there is nothing more we can say, we come together to remember, to hug, to tell stories and shed tears. And so today our communities gather together once more.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: Their faces and voices that night of the first vigil have stayed with me. Thousands had converged to remember the lost, to stand with their friends and loved ones in painful solidarity, to grieve together.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text:
Today marks one year since the fateful October afternoon when 20 souls, beloved by their families, friends & communities, were lost in a terrible limousine crash in Schoharie, New York. 

For a year their loved ones have carried the weight of an unfathomable anguish.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: Once again, the Trump Administration is ignoring climate science and evidence of the devastation already occurring in our communities. This move to block states from being able to #ActOnClimate is reckless climate denial of a kind we can no longer afford.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: Worst of all, this drags us backwards on the #climatecrisis! Transportation is the leading source of U.S. greenhouse gas emissions, and light-duty vehicles account for nearly 60% of those emissions!

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: All of this helps explain why numerous automakers have come out strongly against the Trump Administration‚Äôs proposal and in support of meaningful, predictable year-over-year increases to this powerful standard: https://t.co/3Of7ZU3ILx

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: As we stand still, other nations continue to race forward to develop the next generation of innovative vehicle technologies, virtually guaranteeing future jobs, investments and even new industry creation will happen beyond America's shores.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: This Administration has also pushed to undo future federal clean car standards, even though their own analysis shows this bizarre move will result in significantly more pollution and domestic job loss.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: This misguided move throws it to the courts, triggering years of uncertainty for America's auto industry. Over and over we have heard this Administration pay lip service to cooperative federalism; apparently that only applies to states advancing their extreme deregulation agenda.

tweet_text: Let's be clear: the President has no legal process or justification for revoking this waiver. The Clean Air Act gives California a right to seek it and other states, including New York, have the right to adopt their strong standards.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: Transportation is now the #1 source of greenhouse gas emissions in the U.S. Our work to #ActOnClimate will fall short unless we help build infrastructure for cleaner vehicles. #LIFTAmerica has major funding for transportation electrification & electric vehicle charging stations!

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: We need to make sure every neighborhood & community can benefit from our investments in clean energy deployment. #LIFTAmerica includes $2.25 billion over 5 yrs to create new grant support for distributed energy systems & solar installations in low-income & underserved communities

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: We also know America‚Äôs energy grid is critical security infrastructure that faces threats including increasingly frequent and severe extreme weather events. A more resilient grid will keep us safer and help our communities better withstand these events.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: #LIFTAmerica includes $4 billion over five years for electric grid infrastructure, including grid modernization & resilience upgrades. A smarter grid makes it easier for us to integrate renewable energy resources and superior demand response programs.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: America‚Äôs Weatherization Assistance Program makes small but meaningful investments to get homes in better, more efficient condition. @ENERGY estimates an average annual savings of $283 per home from this cost-effective program!

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: My bill to reauthorize and modernize @ENERGY‚Äôs Weatherization Assistance Program (H.R. 2041) is part of #LIFTAmerica. This program has helped more than 7.4 million low-income households make their homes healthier, safer, and more efficient. https://t.co/B3PECajRGU

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: #LIFTAmerica invests billions in energy efficiency including building retrofits. Buildings consume ~40% of total US energy demand. Despite cost-effective ways to promote efficiency, it‚Äôs still much harder than it should be for homeowners & local gov‚Äôts to make these investments.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: We know the #climatecrisis threatens countless American lives and livelihoods. #LIFTAmerica is a significant down payment on the infrastructure we need for America‚Äôs clean energy transition.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è
tweet_text: #LIFTAmerica also invests $2.7 billion over 5 years for EPA‚Äôs Brownfields program, an incredibly important & successful source of economic revitalization. This program has assessed more than 27,000 contaminated sites & cleaned up nearly 70,000 acres for reuse.

name: Paul Tonko ‚ö´Ô∏è

tweet_text: No amount of deception, misdirection or obstruction will keep us from fulfilling the Constitutional role of Congress to ensure transparency and accountability #ForThePeople. We have a duty to the truth and a responsibility to deliver it to those we serve.

tweet_text: After skipping out on his agreement to testify before the House Judiciary Committee last week, I firmly believe that the Attorney General needs to show his face and justify his actions to Congress and the American people.

tweet_text: His actions reveal America‚Äôs top law enforcement officer serving as the President‚Äôs defense attorney rather than upholding our laws and Constitution.

tweet_text: I also find that Attorney General Barr has repeatedly and seriously misrepresented the Special Counsel‚Äôs findings, including deceptive statements to Congress and the American people on multiple occasions.
